snippet: Pfc. Bradley Manning confessed in open court to providing vast archives of military and diplomatic files to the antisecrecy group WikiLeaks.
abstract: Pfc Bradley Manning confesses in open court to providing vast archives of military and diplomatic files to WikiLeaks, saying that he released information to help enlighten public and spark debate about foreign policy; pleads guilty to 10 criminal counts, exposing himself to up to 20 years in prison; case against him is not over, as military has charged him with more serious offenses, including violation of the Espionage Act.

byline.contributor: Scott Shane contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Pfc. Bradley Manning confessed in open court to providing vast archives of military and diplomatic files to the antisecrecy group WikiLeaks.

headline.seo: Bradley Manning Admits Providing Files to WikiLeaks
headline.main: Soldier Admits Providing Files to WikiLeaks
headline.print_headline: Soldier Admits Providing Files To WikiLeaks
